[b]At the time of this review I have a little over three-hundred (300) hours, more than one-hundred (100) achievements, and my badge progress on steam is level two (2).[/b]

This game is a thrilling, competitive, innovative horror-esque game. This game channels the thriller/slasher movie spirit, and still manages to surprise even the most experienced players at points. It brings together your favourite horror movie/video-game characters and puts them into the same universe. It contains some loose lore and a unique twist on scary games.

With a lack of competition many games face, it can cause developers to feel ‚Äúrelaxed‚Äù to a point, slowing down the progress of their game. I do believe DBD to be a victim of this for the most part. Their lack of competitors seems to have slowed down future updates and fixing predestining game issues, however at the least the DBD still manages to release new fresh and exciting content, and has the marketing team make it all seem very enticing.

I believe Dead by Daylight still manages to hold up despite its issues and more-often-than-not toxic fan base. It has been alive since June 16th, 2016 on PC, they have made the game cross platform on a variety of different consoles, and continue to be active on social media and release leaks. This game isn‚Äôt perfect, and I don‚Äôt think it ever will be. But the thrill of the hunt, chase, and ever-present threat of being slaughtered by the killer at the back of your mind; each step towards the survivors, the blood-lust enough to drive one mad at the forefront of our mind‚Ä¶ well that‚Äôs enough to keep me and millions of other players coming back time and time again.

[strike]The game will be free on the EGL from Dec. 2-9 2021 so it's worth picking up if you've been debating it![/strike]
